channel.title: Building a pc
channel.description:
I'm not sure if this topic is in the right place, but it seems ok to me.
Basically I was talking to my dad about building my own computer, and buying the parts over the internet etc etc. I won't bore you with the details. Anyway, I know the bare minimum about building computers. I know my dad's built a computer, but it was a while ago and I'm not too sure he knows what he's talking about.
Anywaaaayyyy. I was hoping some of you guys could answer some questions, I could Google but I'd much prefer if someone was speaking more specifically about what I'm going to be doing. Catch my drift?
1. Any tips on building one? E.g earthing, etc.
2. What would be a good price for the tower only? I have the monitor etc. Please note I'm not looking for anything top of the range, just something that's reasonably good. I was thinking £200-£400 ($400-$800 IIRC).
3. If someone could post a "template" pc, that would be superb.
Thanks in advance.

item.dc:creator: @pk4pk pk4pk
item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

www.chinapcparts.com

Is slow, failing, and unreliable. Pls use. (Is cheaps)

item.title: Building a pc
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

postmanpat9:

GPU: http://www.dabs.com/ProductView.aspx?Quicklinx=4N78&CategorySelectedId=11137&PageMode=1&NavigationKey=11137,410400000,366360000&InMerch=1, Great card for the price.

Too bad you cant use NewEgg, I got a steal on a 8600GTS. $65 with $10 rebate.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a pc
item.dc:creator: @postmanpat9 postmanpat9
item.description:
@postmanpat9 wrote:

I’ve got the Pioneer DVR-215 very reliable, and cheap too.

^that looks good as well.

item.title: Building a pc
item.dc:creator: @Baros_Rocks Baros Rocks
item.description:
@Baros_Rocks wrote:

Any recommended Disc Drives? None of them look to expensive, but I’m not too sure what’s a good spec

I was thinking something along the lines of this?

http://www.play.com/PC/PCs/-/672/879/-/3563111/Pioneer-DVR-115D-20x-Internal-DVDRW-Drive-Black/Product.html?searchtype=genre

Read full topic

item.title: Building a pc
item.dc:creator: @postmanpat9 postmanpat9
item.description:
@postmanpat9 wrote:

Case + PSU: http://www.dabs.com/productview.aspx?Quicklinx=55D3&CategorySelectedId=11145&PageMode=1&NavigationKey=11145,50915
That comes with a 460w psu which will be fine for your build.
Mobo:great choice on that.
CPU:Again great choice, that will overclock like crazy.
Ram: http://www.dabs.com/productview.aspx?Quicklinx=4Q88&CategorySelectedId=11150&PageMode=1&NavigationKey=11150,4294959063,4294959239,405050000 Thats DDR2800 which will let you overclock your CPU even further.
GPU: http://www.dabs.com/ProductView.aspx?Quicklinx=4N78&CategorySelectedId=11137&PageMode=1&NavigationKey=11137,410400000,366360000&InMerch=1, Great card for the price.
HDD: http://www.dabs.com/ProductView.aspx?Quicklinx=4TJH&CategorySelectedId=11154&PageMode=1&NavigationKey=11154,361720000,50410&InMerch=1 Seagates drives are higher density which will translate to faster read/write times.

If you don’t want to overclock still get the ram as its faster anyway. If you are, consider this cooler as well: http://www.dabs.com/productview.aspx?Quicklinx=4C89&CategorySelectedId=11258&PageMode=1&NavigationKey=11258,4294956808,11,50440

Go ahead and change it as you like just an idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a pc
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“magma828, post:1, topic:218746”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=287394.msg2324984#msg2324984 date=1215650659]
You don’t need to worry about earthing or anything like that, except that it’s a good idea to ground yourself to something while handling components, especially the cpu and ram. You can do this with an anti static wrist strap, there’s different variations, some clip onto something metal and nuetralise with that, some plug into the mains on the wall and make use of the earth there (the best type imo), etc.
[/quote]

Surely the tower has to be permanently earthed…?[/quote]

Yes but you don’t have to worry about it, the PSU is earthed and the power connections all have earth pins if they need them… it’s not liek you have to wire it up yourself…

Read full topic

item.title: Building a pc
item.dc:creator: @Baros_Rocks Baros Rocks
item.description:
@Baros_Rocks wrote:

Ok I tried to put one together:

Case: - £21
http://scan.co.uk/Product.aspx?WebProductId=539676

PSU: - £43
http://www.play.com/PC/PCs/4-/5100623/OCZ-StealthXStream-OCZ500SXS-UK-500W-Power-Supply-Unit-PSU-120mm-Fan/Product.html

Motherboard: - £65
http://www.play.com/PC/PCs/4-/5984845/Gigabyte-GA-EP43-DS3L-ATX-LGA775-P43-Express-Motherboard/Product.html

Processor: - £50
http://www.play.com/PC/PCs/4-/5696599/Intel-Pentium-Dual-Core-E2180-2GHz-LGA775-Processor-CPU/Product.html

RAM: - £26
http://www.play.com/PC/PCs/-/704/911/-/3477789/Computer-Memory-2GB-PC5300-DDR2-240pin-DIMM/Product.html?

Graphics: - £25
http://www.play.com/PC/PCs/-/668/875/-/5173040/Play-Value-Geforce-8400GS-256MB-PCI-Express-X16-Graphics-Card/Product.html?

HDD: - £43
http://www.play.com/PC/PCs/-/671/878/-/3361193/Hitachi-DeskStar-T7K250-0A32159-250GB-Internal-IDE-PATA-3-5-Hard-Drive/Product.html?

Come at around £273, i’ll still need to buy some fans, maybe sound card and network card. Also a cd rom.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a pc
item.dc:creator: @Baros_Rocks Baros Rocks
item.description:
@Baros_Rocks wrote:

The RAM and graphics card aren’t really a problem for me, it’s mainly the case, PSU and fans that are confusing me.

If I managed to put together a PC would someone tell me if i’ve done anything wrong, or there’s a better substitute etc?

Read full topic

item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

By “play with” i meant like, yknow, use as a starting point but change things about as you wish.

ebuyer.co.uk, scan.co.uk, dabs.co.uk

item.title: Building a pc
item.dc:creator: @Baros_Rocks Baros Rocks
item.description:
@Baros_Rocks wrote:

Mopman:

If nobody else does I’ll post a basic list of parts you can play with yourself later, no time atm (and theres people that know better than me) <3

That’s really what I’m looking for, just an example of the main components. Then I can… yeah, play with them.

Also, if someone could use a british site, such as Play.com or Overclockers.co.uk. I’d love them forever.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a pc
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

You don’t need to worry about earthing or anything like that, except that it’s a good idea to ground yourself to something while handling components, especially the cpu and ram. You can do this with an anti static wrist strap, there’s different variations, some clip onto something metal and nuetralise with that, some plug into the mains on the wall and make use of the earth there (the best type imo), etc.

If nobody else does I’ll post a basic list of parts you can play with yourself later, no time atm (and theres people that know better than me) <3

Read full topic
